Dear @all, thanks for coming by the fourth and final sesh of the Network Startup School!  We had some terrific pitches and saw solid energy and progress in many!

Here's a folder with vids and pix from the final session for reference.

https://photos.app.goo.gl/4eDr21EGe8L4ndLeA

Thanks to everyone who attended, taught, participated and generally supported.  I'll be back and forth a few times in Nov and Dec and happy to be a counselor, coach, connector & cajoler to anyone looking to refine their pitch deck and pitching skillz!

Anyone have any appetite/guidance to help pull together a 59 second highlight video with half highlighting vids of the the 6 teachers (Alta, Grace, Akhil, Shara, Brett and myself) and the other time showcasing the 5 pitchers?  Then can ask Balaji to post/repost?  Thanks!

Hey all - Made this for anybody working on the Quizzes (and hoping to get the Balaji-sponsored H20 shot üòÇ)..

Took all the links, videos, & books (all full versions) referenced in the quizzes a generated summaries (briefs), timelines, study guides (if you wanna go deeper/encode in the long-term memory), and mini-podcasts (for my auditory learners!) with NotebookLLM. 

https://ns-quizzes-resources.vercel.app/?vercelToolbarCode=ZbPLcK9rPsN4dbS

 Also should be helpful for anyone building personal knowledge bases, AI 2nd brains, or wanting to add this info to their spaced repetition setup! Working backward (I figured a decent number of us finished 1-3 already), but I'll be deploying the remainder shortly. If people are getting value from it, I'll keep adding to it (additional links/resources, future quizzes, design updates üòÖ). 

Lemme know what you think (and if you find any empty/broken links!), let's get El Cap-i-tain lugging in a case of water to the next lecture..

Doing remote recorded things definitely has its challenges. I did some podcasting before and looked into common issues and how to avoid them. This episode has a lot of great advice. One piece of advice is shipping every guest you do a remote recorded podcast / lecture with a microphone. Even if they have a great microphone, it's better to have all guests use the  same microphone.  That way, you know how to troubleshoot better with that specific equipment.

Slides from today:

Apologies for mic issues today. It was an issue with the guest's microphone. In the future, we will work with remote guest's assistants to test their microphones so that we know that the quality will be good

Can you open comment feature in this doc so we can leave notes there ?

Hey Network Schoolers! I've got a proposal to supercharge our collective learning and project collaboration, which has been amazing already. Here's the gist:

Current issue: We're losing valuable insights in Discord's message stream
Solution: Create a Knowledge Hub using HackMD + GitHub
Benefits: Easier searching, better onboarding, and showcasing our work
Key initiatives: Collective study notes and project approach sharing

Below is the full document and I'd love your input! Let's discuss how we can build together! üí°üåê

https://efficient-shingle-a74.notion.site/Elevating-Our-Network-School-A-Call-for-Collaborative-Learning-and-Building-10f5a3566bd780a38880e930e8ee88b0?pvs=4

If people want to play around a bit with different image generators let me know, I run a service where we offer a lot of different ones on pay-per-image basis. Can shoot you a prefunded account (no strings attached) to try out with and see differences between models - some are better with people, some better with landscapes, some better at fantasy etc.
Also mentioned VoiceMod + XpressionCamera.  When combined you can do real time voice modification + real time video modification (to any image you input, with dynamic matching to your face).

for image creation, can also try flux
https://fal.ai/models/fal-ai/flux/schnell

Here is the categorized list of tools mentioned today, feel free to help add more recommendations:

Image Creation Tools
1. Grok in TwitterGrok
2. Midjourney- www.midjourney.com
3. Leonardo.ai - https://leonardo.ai
4. fluxÔºöhttps://fal.ai/models/fal-ai/flux/schnell

Video Generation Tools
1. Runway Gen 3 Alpha Turbo https://runwayml.com
2. KLING - https://klingai.com
3. Krea AI - https://www.krea.ai/home
4. Hailuo AI Video - https://hailuoai.com
5. DomoAI.app - Tool for generating transitions between videos - https://domoai.app
6. VoiceMod + XpressionCameraÔºöWhen combined you can do real time voice modification + real time video modification (to any image you input, with dynamic matching to your face).

Audio and Music Generation Tools
1. ElevenLabs - Voice generation tool - https://elevenlabs.io
2. Suno - https://suno.com
3. hume - generate voice with impressive emotions - https://www.hume.ai/

Language translation
1. https://www.lipdub.ai/

Feel free to add more tools you recommend, will summarize them within this message here.
